back.text:
Root: ت ب ب (T-B-B)
Meaning: May perish
Pronunciation: Tabbat
Tajweed Rules: Qalqalah on the final ت when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. تَبَاب (Tabāb): Perdition, ruin
2. أَتَبَّ (Atabba): He caused to perish
Example Ayah: لَأَتْرُكَنَّكَ تَبَابًا

hint.text: The opening word of the Sūrah, signifying ruin.

back.text:
Root: ي د ي (Y-D-Y)
Meaning: The two hands
Pronunciation: Yadā
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on the يَا.
Derived Words:
1. يَد (Yad): A hand
2. أَيْد (Ayd): Hands (plural)
3. أَيَادِي (Ayādī): Hands, favors
Example Ayah: بِيَدِهِ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ

hint.text: Refers to the two hands of Abū Lahab.

back.text:
Root: أ ب و (A-B-W)
Meaning: Father of
Pronunciation: Abī
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. أَب (Ab): Father
2. آبَاء (Ābāʾ): Fathers
3. أَبَوَة (Abuwwah): Fatherhood
Example Ayah: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ لِأَبِيهِ آزَرَ

Root: ل ه ب (L-H-B)
Meaning: Flame, blazing fire
Pronunciation: Lahab
Tajweed Rules: Tanwīn pronounced clearly (iẓhār).
Derived Words:
1. لَهِيب (Lahīb): A blaze
2. لَهَبَ (Lahaba): It flamed
Example Ayah: This word is unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān for this specific meaning.

hint.text: The name of the man cursed in the Sūrah.

back.text:
Root: ك س ب (K-S-B)
Meaning: He earned
Pronunciation: Kasaba
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. كَسْب (Kasb): Earning
2. مُكْتَسَب (Muktasab): That which is earned
3. كَاسِب (Kāsib): An earner
Example Ayah: لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ

hint.text: Refers to Abū Lahab's actions and earnings.

back.text:
Root: ص ل ي (Ṣ-L-Y)
Meaning: He will burn
Pronunciation: Yaṣlā
Tajweed Rules: Istiʿlā (heaviness) on Ṣād; madd on the final ā.
Derived Words:
1. صَلَىٰ (Ṣalā): He burned
2. صِلِيّ (Ṣiliyy): Burning
Example Ayah: The verb form is unique to this Sūrah.

Root: ح م ل (Ḥ-M-L)
Meaning: The carrier
Pronunciation: Ḥammālata
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on مّ.
Derived Words:
1. حَمْل (Ḥaml): A load
2. حَمَلَ (Ḥamala): He carried
3. حِمَالَة (Ḥimālah): A guarantee or load
Example Ayah: وَلَيَحْمِلُنَّ أَثْقَالَهُمْ

Root: ح ط ب (Ḥ-Ṭ-B)
Meaning: The firewood
Pronunciation: Al-Ḥaṭab
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah; Tafkhīm on Ṭāʾ.
Derived Words:
1. حَطَبَ (Ḥaṭaba): He gathered firewood
Example Ayah: This noun is unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

Root: ح ب ل (Ḥ-B-L)
Meaning: A rope
Pronunciation: Ḥablun
Tajweed Rules: Qalqalah on ب.
Derived Words:
1. حَبَل (Ḥabal): Pregnancy
2. اِحْتَبَلَ (Iḥtabala): To ensnare
Example Ayah: وَاعْتَصِمُوا بِحَبْلِ اللَّهِ جَمِيعًا

hint.text: Her neck will be bound by it.

back.text:
Root: م س د (M-S-D)
Meaning: Palm fiber, twisted rope
Pronunciation: Masad
Tajweed Rules: Idghām with ghunnah of the tanwīn if followed by a nasal letter.
Derived Words:
1. مِسَاد (Misād): A rope or cord of fiber
Example Ayah: This noun is unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: The material of the rope around her neck.
